answerFeedback.0eb2af6b-0369-4978-8acd-8c958df441ce: Incorrect because changes in revenue attributable to volume or price/mix are organic growth and are shown separately from the impact of acquisitions and divestitures (scope change) and foreign exchange (forex impact in the model).
answerFeedback.1204700c-12f1-44b4-ac40-8c737c9cef1e: Correct because changes in revenue attributable to volume or price/mix are organic growth and are shown separately from the impact of acquisitions and divestitures (scope change) and foreign exchange (forex impact in the model).
answerFeedback.c64ec08e-95c9-470d-9293-9869427d84d1: Incorrect because changes in revenue attributable to volume or price/mix are organic growth and are shown separately from the impact of acquisitions and divestitures (scope change) and foreign exchange (forex impact in the model).

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-04380
entry.itemBody: Deferred tax liabilities could arise when:

answerFeedback.0c50a449-7651-417a-9c74-5da1fdc25edf: Correct because deferred tax liabilities result from temporary timing differences between a company's income as reported for tax purposes (taxable income) and income as reported for financial statement purposes (reported income). Deferred tax liabilities arise when a deficit amount is paid for income taxes and company expects to eliminate the deficit over the course of future operations. In this case, financial accounting income tax expense exceeds income taxes payable.
answerFeedback.a7825508-f045-4a03-a269-3c4ffc2e5fce: Incorrect because the tax base of equipment being higher than its carrying value creates a deferred tax asset. A deferred tax liability would be reported if carrying value of equipment were higher than its tax base.
answerFeedback.b638a88b-673f-4d9d-9329-6cc8ba7e8053: Incorrect because income or expense items not allowed by tax legislation create a permanent difference that will not be reversed at some future date. Because they will not be reversed at a future date, these differences do not give rise to deferred tax. Deferred tax liabilities are created because of temporary differences that are expected to reverse in the future. All permanent differences result in a difference between the company's effective tax rate and statutory tax rate.

choices.itemBody: A. accounting profit is greater than taxable income.
B. the tax base of equipment is greater than its carrying value.
C. tax authorities do not allow an expense item for tax purposes.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-07414
entry.itemBody: All else being equal, a government's budget deficit is most likely reduced after the introduction of:

answerFeedback.05bac7d7-aef4-43d0-ba1f-b28b383c535c: Correct because tariffs are taxes that a government levies on imported goods. Therefore, all else being equal, the imposition of a tariff will increase government revenue and thereby reduce a government budget deficit.
answerFeedback.0f77619b-6299-44f7-8261-18f8fad535c2: Incorrect because an export subsidy will increase a government's budget deficit, not reduce it.
answerFeedback.c714a318-a8c6-45f9-b2d0-270e3cf466b3: Incorrect because an export subsidy is a payment by the government to a firm for each unit of a good that is exported. All else being equal, a new export subsidy will increase a government's budget deficit.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.03-Quant-Croitoru-15
entry.itemBody: Which of the following statements about prediction intervals is most accurate? All else being equal:

answerFeedback.39fe46ee-9a65-4606-837c-10e9fce71d64:
Incorrect because the standard error of the forecast is sf = se (1 + 1/n + (Xf –X)2 /Σi=1n (Xi –X)2)0.5 

The standard error of the forecast depends on the variation of the independent variable [Σi=1n (Xi –X)2 ]

From the equation of the standard error of the forecast, the smaller variation of the independent variable will increase the standard error of the forecast, and thus will result in a wider prediction interval.
answerFeedback.a3c6a907-e1de-4fee-bdf5-24a29f017d64: Incorrect because the better the fit of the regression model, the smaller the standard error of the estimate (se) and, therefore, the smaller standard error of the forecast. Moreover, once we have this estimate of the standard error of the forecast, determining a prediction interval around the predicted value of the dependent variable (Ŷf ) is very similar to estimating a confidence interval around an estimated parameter. The prediction interval is Ŷf   ± t critical for α/2 sf. Thus, a smaller standard error of the estimate will result in a narrower prediction interval.
answerFeedback.ddcfa1f2-6ee6-4076-918e-80f029946608: Correct because the larger the sample size (n) in the regression estimation, the smaller the standard error of the forecast. This is evident from the equation for the standard error of the forecast, which is sf = se (1 + 1/n + (Xf –X)2 /Σi=1n (Xi –X)2)0.5

choices.itemBody: A. the width of the prediction interval does not depend on the standard error of the estimate.
B. a smaller variation of the independent variable will result in a narrower prediction interval.
C. a larger sample size in the regression estimation will result in a smaller standard error of the forecast.

entry.title: ITEM_20180516073
entry.itemBody:
Selected year-end financial data for a company is as follows:
Net income $200,000
Tax rate 15%
Weighted average number of common shares outstanding 125,000
12% bond convertible into 3,000 common shares (potentially dilutive) $60,000

Given this information, the diluted EPS of the company is closest to:

answerFeedback.063b99aa-4f68-49ce-97a3-334da73bbe87:
Correct. First determine the basic EPS, calculated as follows:

 

Basis EPS =  (Net income - Preferred dividends) Weighted average # of shares outstanding = ( $200,000 - $0 125,000 ) = $1 .60

Next, calculate diluted EPS using the if-converted method for the convertible debt:

Diluted EPS =  Net income + after-tax interest on convertible debt - Preferred dividends Weighted average number  of shares outstanding  + Additional common shares that  would have been issued at conversion = [ $200,000 - ($60,000 x 0 .12 x (1 - 0 .15)) - $0 ] 125,000 + 3,000 = $193,880 128,000 = $ 1.61

The calculated diluted EPS is greater than the basic EPS. By definition, the diluted EPS is always equal to or less than basic EPS and this means that the diluted EPS will be $1.60.
answerFeedback.0715fe2e-20a8-470a-8434-1af660db38c3:
Incorrect because it miscalculates the effect of the after-tax interest on debt in the if-converted method used for the convertible debt to determine the diluted EPS:

Diluted EPS =  Net income - after-tax interest on convertible debt - Preferred dividends Weighted average number  of shares outstanding  + Additional common shares that  would have been issued at conversion = $200,000 - [$60,000 x 0 .12 x (1 - 0 .15)] - 0 125,000 + 3,000 = $193,880 128,000 = $ 1.51

The $1.51 is a result due to mistakenly subtracting the after-tax interest on the debt. It should be added.
answerFeedback.8e35e0e6-b460-44d7-8155-13b2a2622592: Incorrect because, as elaborated in the response rationale to the correct answer, the calculated diluted EPS is $1.61 and the calculated basic EPS is $1.60.  Because the diluted EPS is always equal to or less than basic EPS, then the diluted EPS is $1.60, not $1.61.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.03-Quant-Tomter-03
entry.itemBody: Samples are drawn from a population by selecting every kth member of the population. This sampling method is best described as:

answerFeedback.8395d88a-abab-4c81-bd57-6ba1045113c1: Incorrect because in stratified random sampling, the population is divided into subpopulations (strata) based on one or more classification criteria. Simple random samples are then drawn from each stratum in sizes proportional to the relative size of each stratum in the population. These samples are then pooled to form a stratified random sample. In this case, every kth member of the population is selected, instead of selections from subpopulations.
answerFeedback.916ff01b-1abe-45f6-982f-0861dafcf66a: Correct because with systematic sampling, we select every kth member until we have a sample of the desired size.
answerFeedback.9e59f45f-2dc7-4da6-b841-fe69d07991c9: Incorrect because like stratified random sampling, cluster sampling also requires the division or classification of the population into subpopulation groups, called clusters. In this method, the population is divided into clusters, each of which is essentially a mini-representation of the entire population. In this case, every kth member of the population is selected instead of selections from subpopulations.

entry.title: ITEM_20170502097
entry.itemBody:
A project has the following annual cash flows:
Year 0 Year 1 Year 2 Year 3
–$606,061 $2,151,515 –$2,542,424 $1,000,000

Which discount rate most likely provides a positive NPV?

answerFeedback.5872cee7-0f45-4a3f-b50d-76d7735d7897:
Correct because the NPV at 21% is $14.7, whereas the NPVs at other two discount rates are negative.

Year Cash Flow r = 15% r = 18% r = 21% Calculation
0 –$606,061 –$606,061.00 –$606,061.00 –$606,061.00 –606,061
1 2,151,515 1,870,882.60 1,823,317.80 1,778,111.60 +2,151,515/(1 + r)
2 –2,542,424 –1,922,437.80 –1,825,929.30 –1,736,509.80 –2,542,424/(1 + r)2
3 1,000,000 657,516.20 608,630.90 564,473.90 +1,000,000/(1 + r)3
 
NPV –$100.00 –$41.60 +$14.70 r = Discount rate
answerFeedback.e678cca6-7aa7-4d6e-9798-b6c611ff7b12: Incorrect because a discount rate of 18% results in a negative NPV.
answerFeedback.f7cd1349-4d4a-44f2-859a-4c50711acf47: Incorrect because a discount rate of 15% results in a negative NPV.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-Econ-Elkinawy-Young-08
entry.itemBody: An example of an expansionary fiscal policy is:

answerFeedback.6d034faa-633e-4905-958d-f935ddafc830: Incorrect because open market operations is a tool of monetary policy. Monetary policy refers to action taken by a nation’s central bank to affect aggregate output and prices through changes in bank reserves, reserve requirements, or its target interest rate. The central bank buys securities from banks in an open-market operation, it pays for them with a corresponding increase in bank reserves.
answerFeedback.7d2b5949-3960-457c-8a92-727c7ac1e15f: Correct because an expansionary fiscal policy could include new public spending on social goods and infrastructure, such as hospitals and schools, boosting personal incomes with the objective of raising aggregate demand.
answerFeedback.bb7cad29-1bd4-4bdd-9b5c-54f9095e52bd: Incorrect because changing bank reserve requirements is a tool of monetary policy. Monetary policy refers to action taken by a nation’s central bank to affect aggregate output and prices through changes in bank reserves, reserve requirements, or its target interest rate.

choices.itemBody: A. a reduction in bank reserve requirements.
B. an increase in public spending on social goods and infrastructure.
C. the purchase of government bonds through open market operations.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.03-Corp Issuers-Su-16
entry.itemBody:
An analyst gathers the following information about a company's sources of capital:

Source of Capital Amount Raised Before-tax Cost of Capital
Equity  $15 million 8%
Debt $10 million 4%
Preferred stock   $1 million 5%

If interest is tax-deductible, a 35% marginal tax rate results in a WACC closest to:

answerFeedback.0f0f6827-15f9-46c6-add6-04ee70f48ef5:
Correct because WACC = wdrd(1–t) + wprp + were = 0.385×4%(1–35%) + 0.038×5% + 0.577×8% = 5.808% ≈ 5.81%.

 

Where, 

wd = $10 million/($15 million+$10 million+$1 million) = $10 million/$26 million = 0.385

wp = $1 million/$26 million = 0.038

we = $15 million/$26 million = 0.577
answerFeedback.493124e5-eefa-4408-9c7b-6289ccedca77:
Incorrect because the tax shield was not applied to the cost of debt. 

 

WACC ≠ wdrd + wprp + were = 0.385×4% + 0.038×5% + 0.577×8% = 6.346% ≈ 6.35%.

 

Where, 

wd = $10 million/($15 million+$10 million+$1 million) = $10 million/$26 million = 0.385

wp = $1 million/$26 million = 0.038

we = $15 million/$26 million = 0.577
answerFeedback.4c1d379c-25f5-4bd5-a9d4-6c771c35d885:
Incorrect because a tax shield was applied to the cost of preferred stock as well.

 

WACC ≠ wdrd(1–t) + wprp(1–t) + were = 0.385×4%(1–35%) + 0.038×5%(1–35%) + 0.577×8% = 5.740% = 5.74%.

 

Where, 

wd = $10 million/($15 million+$10 million+$1 million) = $10 million/$26 million = 0.385

wp = $1 million/$26 million = 0.038

we = $15 million/$26 million = 0.577

entry.title: ITEM_20170421163
entry.itemBody: Over a 4-year period, a portfolio has returns of 10%, −2%, 18%, and −12%. The geometric mean return across the period is closest to:

answerFeedback.9b41f0cd-a240-4c92-8d04-309d316d9c26:
Correct because the geometric mean return is:

RG = < [ ∏ ( t = 1 ) T ( 1 + R t ) ] ( 1 / T ) − 1

where Rt is the annual return.  

Plugging in the numbers, the geometric mean return is:

= [(1 + 0.10) × (1 − 0.02) × (1 + 0.18) × (1 − 0.12)]0.25 − 1

= 0.0286 ≈ 2.9%
answerFeedback.bcdeb7be-4e5b-4049-9c3c-1e49f4ab52cd: Incorrect because it is the geometric average of the given numbers, but without adding one, i.e., (10 × −2 × 18 × −12)0.25 = 8.10%.
answerFeedback.fa79621c-dd59-4533-975d-793d86834dba: Incorrect because it is the arithmetic average, or = (10 − 2 + 18 − 12) / 4 = 3.5%.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-01967
entry.itemBody:
An analyst collects the following information about a company:

Net profit margin 4%
Return on average assets 8%
Return on average equity 16%
Revenue €2,500,000

The company's:

answerFeedback.60efed96-dc0e-4863-b325-a894b2677d90: Correct because the company had net profit of €100,000 calculated as revenue × Net profit margin = €2,500,000 × 4% = €100,000. Return on equity = Net profit ÷ Average shareholders' equity. Therefore, average shareholders' equity = Net profit ÷ Return on Equity = €100,000 ÷ 16% = €625,000.
answerFeedback.c43ade6f-5df1-48da-ac05-eed7a4d2c9d3: Incorrect because ROA = Net profit ÷ Average total assets. Therefore, average total assets = Net profit ÷ 8% = €100,000 ÷ 8% = €1,250,000. Total asset turnover = Revenue ÷ Average total assets = €2,500,000 ÷ €1,250,000 = 2
answerFeedback.c636efac-0312-4950-bf59-225cc619c59a: Incorrect because Return on equity = ROA × Leverage and, therefore, Leverage = ROE ÷ ROA = 16% ÷ 8% = 2

entry.title: ITEM_20170502010
entry.itemBody: The cost of which source of capital most likely requires adjustment for taxes in the calculation of a firm’s weighted average cost of capital?

answerFeedback.346d0844-585f-4219-bafc-ccecf25ec70a: Incorrect because adjustment for taxes is applicable for the cost of debt and not in the cost of equity.
answerFeedback.6ba04e15-01c8-40cc-99ca-96de0509fca8: Correct. Bonds are a form of debt that must be adjusted for taxes when calculating the weighted average cost of capital.
answerFeedback.e356116d-604b-4dfe-b62a-e774be1af356: Incorrect because adjustment for taxes is applicable for the cost of debt and not in the cost of equity.

entry.title: ITEM_20170608196
entry.itemBody:
The following information is available about a company ($ millions):
Year Ended 31 December Year 2 Year 1
Sales 322.8 320.1
Net income 27.2 26.8
Cash flow from operations 15.3 38.1

During Year 2, the company most likely experienced a significant decrease in:

answerFeedback.2c19e597-b4d7-4f75-bb6b-0775198ee458: Incorrect because a decrease in inventory would increase cash from operations.
answerFeedback.8e91acf8-ae3e-4f55-9d74-4620debe5730: Correct because sales are nearly the same for the two years. A decrease in the proportion of cash sales implies an increase in the proportion of credit sales, which would increase accounts receivable and decrease cash flow from operations.
answerFeedback.b9dd8f94-4904-463e-80d7-2250f7faa1bb: Incorrect because an increase in payables would increase cash from operations.

choices.itemBody: B. the proportion of sales made on a cash basis.
C. the proportion of interest-bearing debt relative to trade accounts payable.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.05-Econ-Elliott-23
entry.itemBody: The neutral policy rate for an economy is the real trend rate of growth and the:

answerFeedback.65235f3f-ba34-48ff-8996-a45d4c692ad5: Incorrect because it is the long-term growth rate, not short-term, that gives rise to stable inflation. The formula is neutral rate = trend growth + inflation target.
answerFeedback.9c2aabf3-13dc-4f03-95a9-09690649281e: Correct because the neutral policy rate for any economy comprises two components: real trend rate of growth of the underlying economy, and the real trend rate of growth of an economy that is achievable in the long run that gives rise to stable inflation. The formula is neutral rate = Trend growth + Inflation target.
answerFeedback.ccd86beb-96b6-482e-b83f-cf1303d01534: Incorrect because it is the long-term growth rate that gives rise to stable inflation. No inflation is in fact stable inflation (zero), but this does not best describe the equation. The formula is neutral rate = trend growth + inflation target.

choices.itemBody: A. short-term growth rate that gives rise to no inflation.
B. long-term growth rate that gives rise to stable inflation.
C. short-term growth rate that gives rise to stable inflation.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.01-CorpIssuers-Tsependa-11
entry.itemBody: Which of the following stakeholders are most likely responsible for implementing a public corporation’s strategy?

answerFeedback.7472ea4e-0562-4bc8-ac55-0278bc75e88f: Incorrect because a company’s board of directors is elected by shareholders to protect shareholders’ interests and provide strategic direction, taking into consideration the company’s risk appetite, which it defines for the company. So the board may approve the strategy and oversee its implementation, but managers, led by the chief executive officer of the company, are responsible for determining and implementing the corporation’s strategy under the oversight of the board of directors.
answerFeedback.a3249a51-a794-4be9-ad51-94e09bf33985: Incorrect because governments seek to protect the interests of the general public and ensure the well-being of their nations’ economies. But they do not determine or implement the strategies for specific companies, unless they act as managers in these companies. Managers, led by the chief executive officer of the company, are responsible for determining and implementing the corporation’s strategy under the oversight of the board of directors.
answerFeedback.aaaa4c94-98a7-42f2-8357-f48b526691c1: Correct because managers, led by the chief executive officer of the company, are responsible for determining and implementing the corporation’s strategy under the oversight of the board of directors.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2023.01-CorpIssuers-Harper-02
entry.itemBody: Which organizational form of business has limited liability for some owners and passes through profits and losses to owners for taxation purposes?

answerFeedback.325ceb0e-f4f1-4e33-98e7-ed3a2d93b81e: Correct because like sole proprietorships, partnerships are typically pass-through businesses for tax purposes. Pass-through businesses are not taxed at the entity level, passing on all their profits or losses to the partners who are taxed personally. In addition, in a limited partnership, there must be at least one general partner (GP) with unlimited liability that often manages the business. Remaining partners, however, called limited partners (LPs), have limited liability, meaning their losses are limited to the size of their investment in the limited partnership, and may not have any management responsibilities.
answerFeedback.372e52e2-df9c-4b8e-9145-57d07d40c53c: Incorrect because in a sole proprietorship, the owner retains all return (profits), which is taxed as personal income, and is personally responsible for losses and obligations of the business, such as debts.
answerFeedback.d8e8a98a-3e6d-4103-8906-e1c87abdb4f0: Incorrect because public limited companies (corporations) are disadvantaged in most jurisdictions compared to the other organizational forms in one respect: taxation. While other forms are taxed only on business income and loss at the owner (personal) level, public limited companies are taxed at the business level and again at the personal level if profits are distributed to shareholders.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-FRA-Shaw-03
entry.itemBody: Which of the following types of financial ratios is most likely to be positively affected by an inventory write-down compared to if the write-down had not occurred?

answerFeedback.16056837-7952-4f95-9936-882e0e5b3ce7: Incorrect because an inventory write-down reduces both profit and the carrying amount of inventory on the balance sheet and thus has a negative effect on profitability, liquidity, and solvency ratios.
answerFeedback.18988b2d-548c-475e-9cca-229507018d6f: Incorrect because an inventory write-down reduces both profit and the carrying amount of inventory on the balance sheet and thus has a negative effect on profitability, liquidity, and solvency ratios.
answerFeedback.e70f60d6-8357-45e2-9c12-2da5effb8abc: Correct because an inventory write-down reduces both profit and the carrying amount of inventory on the balance sheet and thus has a negative effect on profitability, liquidity, and solvency ratios. However, activity ratios (for example, inventory turnover and total asset turnover) will be positively affected by a write-down because the asset base (denominator) is reduced.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.03-CorpIssuers-Kashyap-22
entry.itemBody: In which stage of a company's life cycle is cash flow most likely to be negative?

answerFeedback.3b02616b-a3b6-4be1-80ab-29275faefff5: Incorrect because at the maturity stage, a company’s revenue growth may slow or even begin to decline. At this stage, however, a successful business generates reliable and positive cash flow and likely has an established customer and supplier base.
answerFeedback.6aede066-9457-443d-84f6-6393322bb53b: Incorrect because as the business progresses through the growth stage, execution and competitive risks decline. Cash flow typically turns positive and then becomes more stable and predictable as the business grows.
answerFeedback.767d1a22-8a35-420c-9df6-8d16da90cb37: Correct because early in its life, a company is typically a cash consumer. Investment is required to advance concepts through the prototype stage and into commercial production. Revenues are zero or minimal, and risk of business failure is high. The company must raise capital, and since the timing and potential for cash flow generation are highly uncertain, it will generally raise equity rather than debt.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-08397
entry.itemBody:
An analyst gathers the following information (in € millions) about a company:

Cost of sales 800
Decrease in inventory 250
Increase in accounts payable 100

Cash paid to suppliers (in € millions) is:

answerFeedback.5cf6a951-b7b8-41e0-aa1e-a9e65b93417b: Incorrect because Decrease in inventory has been added to Cost of goods sold in calculating Purchase from suppliers. €800 million + €250 million = €1,050 million. Cash paid to suppliers = Purchase from suppliers – Increase in accounts payable = €1,050 million – €100 million = €950 million.
answerFeedback.6069592e-d42c-4a38-a5e5-4f6c1e0059ef: Incorrect because Decrease in inventory has been added to Cost of goods sold in calculating Purchase from suppliers. €800 million + €250 million = €1,050 million; and Increase in accounts payable has been added to Purchase from suppliers. €1,050 million + €100 million = €1,150 million.
answerFeedback.a38676df-43c4-47e0-8614-07d2869409e1: Correct because Purchases from suppliers = Cost of goods sold – Decrease in inventory = €800 million – €250 million = €550 million. Cash paid to suppliers = Purchase from suppliers – Increase in accounts payable = €550 million – €100 million = €450 million.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.01-Quant-Pitrakkou-04
entry.itemBody:
An analyst gathers the following probability distribution of a company’s EPS:

Probability EPS ($)
0.1 22.0
0.9 30.0

The standard deviation of EPS is closest to:

answerFeedback.99cc8ffd-4409-41b4-87c3-fca4ddf6b4ff: Incorrect because this is equal to the variance not the standard deviation. This is the square of the standard deviation. i.e. σ2 (EPS) = P($22.0) × [$22.0 – E(EPS)]2 + P($30.0) × [$30.0 – E(EPS)]2 = 0.1 × [$22.0 – $29.2]2 + 0.9 × [$30.0 – $29.2]2 = $5.184 + $0.576 = $5.760 ≈ $5.8.
answerFeedback.cc3bd6fa-af95-4542-b9f5-d9f56db5095d: Correct because standard deviation is the positive square root of variance and the variance of a random variable is the expected value (the probability-weighted average) of squared deviations from the random variable’s expected value. Therefore, the expected value of EPS is equal to: E(EPS) = 0.1 × $22.0 + 0.9 × $30.0 = $2.2 + $27.0 = $29.2. The variance is equal to: σ2 (EPS) = P($22.0) × [$22.0 – E(EPS)]2 + P($30.0) × [$30.0 – E(EPS)]2 = 0.1 × [$22.0 – $29.2]2 + 0.9 × [$30.0 – $29.2]2 = $5.184 + $0.576 = $5.760. Therefore the standard deviation of EPS is σ = ($5.760)1/2 ≈ $2.4.
answerFeedback.da2186fb-16ac-472c-a6b6-46ab00f6da3e:
Incorrect because this response uses a simple average for EPS instead of a probability-weighted average. That is, it assumes: E(EPS) = ($22.0 + $30.0) / 2 = $26.0.

Thus the variance is equal to: σ2 (EPS) = P($22.0) × [$22.0 – E(EPS)]2 + P($30.0) × [$30.0 – E(EPS)]2 = 0.1 × [$22.0 – $26.0]2 + 0.9 × [$30.0 – $26.0]2 = $1.6 + $14.4 = $16.0 and the standard deviation of EPS is σ = ($16.0)1/2 = $4.0.

entry.title: ITEM_2019B Quant 07KJG 11U1
entry.itemBody:
An analyst gathers the following company P/E ratios:

8 13 3 12 8 10

For the data given, the:

answerFeedback.7acabd5f-56ea-4981-8853-9df941e7c468: Incorrect because the arithmetic mean and the median are equal for the data given. The arithmetic mean is the sum of the observations divided by the number of observations. Hence, the arithmetic mean of the data given is: (8 + 13 + 3 + 12 + 8 + 10)/6 = 54/6 = 9. The median is the value of the middle item of a set of items that has been sorted into ascending or descending order. In an even-numbered sample, we define the median as the mean of the values of items occupying the n/2 and (n + 2)/2 positions (the two middle items).The items when sorted into ascending order are 3, 8, 8, 10, 12, 13. Hence, the median is (8 + 10)/2 = 9 since there are an even number of items. This answer is chosen if we fail to reorder the items when calculating the median, concluding that the median is (3 + 12)/2 = 7.5, which is less than the arithmetic mean of 9.
answerFeedback.91ba2240-5d6e-4a04-a6f1-a7d36b51a1e2: Correct because the median of the data is equal to 9, which is greater than the mode of 8. The median is the value of the middle item of a set of items that has been sorted into ascending or descending order. In an even-numbered sample, we define the median as the mean of the values of items occupying the n/2 and ( n + 2)/2 positions (the two middle items). The items when sorted into ascending order are 3, 8, 8, 10, 12, 13. Hence, the median is (8 + 10)/2 = 9 since there are an even number of items. The mode is the most frequently occurring value in a distribution. Hence, the mode for the data given is 8 since this is the only value occurring twice.
answerFeedback.ffee79a8-8707-4063-b8bd-c78d505b4918: Incorrect because the mode is less than, not greater than, the arithmetic mean of the data given. The mode is the most frequently occurring value in a distribution. Hence, the mode for the data given is 8 since this is the only value occurring twice. The arithmetic mean is the sum of the observations divided by the number of observations. Hence, the arithmetic mean of the data given is: (8 + 13 + 3 + 12 + 8 + 10)/6 = 54/6 = 9.

choices.itemBody: A. median is greater than the mode.
B. mode is greater than the arithmetic mean.
C. arithmetic mean is greater than the median.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020B-CorpFin-Hung-02
entry.itemBody: Conflicts of interest between shareholders and management most likely occur when:

answerFeedback.34752336-1b45-4a80-ae22-004b25b88094: Incorrect because if an executive remuneration plan offers cash only, the interests of management and investors (and other stakeholders) may be misaligned. An equity-based compensation plan is commonly used to align management interests with those of shareholders. Therefore, deferred shares, i.e., equity, can be employed to align management interests with those of shareholders.
answerFeedback.4c64b598-b181-4b58-aa2b-729fcfd26ffa: Correct because by allowing shareholders to express their views on remuneration matters, companies can limit the discretion of directors and managers in granting themselves excessive (or inadequate) remuneration, thus not allowing managers to have greater discretion over their own pay. Hence, if shareholders do not or miss to influence the design of executive compensation packages, conflicts of interest between shareholders and management may occur.
answerFeedback.7092da09-951f-4086-b1c9-59a338051596: Incorrect because while management compensation seeks to motivate managers to maximize shareholder value, manager and shareholder interests may diverge as it relates to risk appetite. Compensation dominated by stock grants and options can motivate excessive management risk-taking, as option holders participate only in upside share price moves. Similarly, little or no use of stock grants and options in compensation plans can lead to unduly risk-averse corporate decision-making and the inability to attract talent. This misalignment may be at odds with the company’s value creation objective or shareholders’ desire for higher-risk, higher-reward endeavors. Since investors can hold diversified portfolios, they may have a higher risk tolerance than managers, whose reputation and time are concentrated in a single company. In other words, when risky projects that match shareholders' risk tolerance are pursued by the company, there is no conflict of interest between shareholders and management.

choices.itemBody: B. shareholders do not influence the design of executive compensation packages.
C. risky projects that match shareholders' risk tolerance are pursued by the company.

entry.title: ITEM_2019B FRA 16KYL
entry.itemBody: Under the acquisition method, if the purchase price of an acquired company exceeds the sum of the fair value amounts that can be allocated to individual identifiable assets and liabilities, the acquiring company should record the excess as:

answerFeedback.1b95a871-e180-418e-a125-8cdb8c5e72aa: Incorrect because the excess should be recorded as an intangible asset.
answerFeedback.e49e2185-2649-4453-83c8-d603acbd4658: Correct because under the acquisition method, the company identified as the acquirer allocates the purchase price to each asset acquired (and each liability assumed) on the basis of its fair value. If the purchase price exceeds the sum of the amounts that can be allocated to individual identifiable assets and liabilities, the excess is recorded as goodwill.
answerFeedback.f93f7f44-9e74-4b02-b3e9-3dc51d23bbf4: Incorrect because the excess should be recorded as an intangible asset.

choices.itemBody: B. a gain reflected in profit and loss.
C. a gain reflected in other comprehensive income.

entry.title: ITEM_20180516094
entry.itemBody: Under IFRS, which component of the change in the net pension asset or liability each period is recognized in other comprehensive income?

answerFeedback.3ad0b1f0-aa24-402c-a490-91c26dfe6b0b: Incorrect because the net interest expense or income accrued on the beginning net pension plan asset or liability is reported as pension expense in profit and loss.
answerFeedback.40b457cb-5d24-4e30-b6a5-3166b89a57ff: Incorrect because employees’ service costs are reported as pension expense in profit and loss.
answerFeedback.4e2058f0-10ab-4098-9ed7-7edd755257fb: Correct because under IFRS, the change in the net pension asset or liability each period is viewed as having three general components. Two of the components of this change are recognized as pension expense in profit and loss: (1) employees’ service costs and (2) the net interest expense or income accrued on the beginning net pension asset or liability. The third item, remeasurements, is recognized in other comprehensive income.

choices.itemBody: B. Actuarial gains and losses and other remeasurements
C. The net interest expense or income accrued on the beginning net pension plan asset or liability

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.01-Econ-Zhang-09
entry.itemBody: With respect to geopolitics, which of the following is best described as a financial tool?

answerFeedback.316aec9c-ca10-4bed-bb43-9970abc814e4: Incorrect because it is an economic tool. Among state actors, economic tools can include multilateral trade agreements.
answerFeedback.382c02b1-2a9d-44b5-88a5-8fffd4b2ea71: Incorrect because it is an economic tool. Highly cooperative economic tools may also include common markets.
answerFeedback.c16b870b-f865-4b2a-8056-8bba6515bc8a: Correct because examples of cooperative financial tools include the free exchange of currencies across borders and allowing foreign investment.

choices.itemBody: C. Free exchange of currencies across borders

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.03-Quant-Croitoru-14
entry.itemBody:
An analyst runs a simple linear regression using 35 months of data to assess a country's short-term interest rate as a function of its inflation rate, with the following results:

  Coefficients Standard Error
Intercept −0.5778 0.3479
Inflation rate 1.1300 0.1806

Critical t-values for a 1% level of significance:

One-sided, left side: −2.445
One-sided, right side: +2.445
Two-sided: ±2.733

At a 99% confidence level, the analyst should reject the null hypothesis that:

answerFeedback.2c562dda-161f-41ef-beee-d51448a27040: Incorrect because the calculated t-statistic for testing whether the intercept is zero is t = (–0.5778 – 0.0000) /0.3479 = –1.6608 which is within the bounds of ±2.733 (being a two-sided hypothesis test), so the analyst fails to reject the null hypothesis that the intercept is zero.
answerFeedback.77b54a7c-bb43-4666-b4b4-d0f85c391a05: Incorrect because the calculated t-statistic for testing the slope against 0.765 is t = (1.1300 – 0.7500) /0.1806 = 2.1041, which is less than the critical value of +2.445 (being a one-sided hypothesis test). Thus, the analyst fails to reject the null hypothesis that the slope is less than or equal to 0.75.
answerFeedback.ba7464c8-aa69-4fa5-9af4-a71039ff3a7a: Correct because we reject the null hypothesis that there is no linear relationship between the two variables, that is that the slope of the linear regression is zero, if the calculated t-statistic is less than −2.733 or greater than +2.733 (being a two-sided hypothesis test). Indeed, t-statistic = (1.1300 – 0.0000)/ 0.1806 = 6.2569, which is greater than +2.733

choices.itemBody: B. the slope is less than or equal to 0.75.
C. there is no linear relationship between the country's inflation rate and short-term interest rate.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-Quant-Tsependa-05
entry.itemBody: Which of the following test statistics is most appropriate for a hypothesis test concerning the mean difference between two normally distributed populations?

answerFeedback.53fa711e-05b7-4cbd-af4d-8e02a73e9cee: Incorrect because for a Test of Mean Differences (Normally Distributed Populations, Unknown Population Variances), when we have data consisting of paired observations from samples generated by normally distributed populations with unknown variances, a t-test is based on t = (d − μd0)/sd, with n − 1 degrees of freedom, where n is the number of paired observations, d is the sample mean difference, and sd is the standard error of d. In tests concerning the variance of a single normally distributed population (not the mean difference between two populations), we make use of a chi-square test statistic.
answerFeedback.c1e9639e-7a78-4902-ab91-456e9251d652: Incorrect because for a Test of Mean Differences (Normally Distributed Populations, Unknown Population Variances), when we have data consisting of paired observations from samples generated by normally distributed populations with unknown variances, a t-test is based on t = (d − μd0)/sd, with n − 1 degrees of freedom, where n is the number of paired observations, d is the sample mean difference, and sd is the standard error of d. An F-test can be appropriate for Tests Concerning Differences between the Variances of Two Populations.
answerFeedback.ca466c57-e1cc-4751-be8e-d181456b41ff: Correct because for a Test of Mean Differences (Normally Distributed Populations, Unknown Population Variances), when we have data consisting of paired observations from samples generated by normally distributed populations with unknown variances, a t-test is based on t = (d − μd0)/sd, with n − 1 degrees of freedom, where n is the number of paired observations, d is the sample mean difference, and sd is the standard error of d.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.01-Econ-Coorey-01
entry.itemBody: Globalization is primarily the result of:

answerFeedback.5c5c0157-b12a-4e1b-803b-021e118ac8f9: Incorrect because political cooperation and non-cooperation is one lens by which to consider geopolitical actors—primarily national or state actors. Globalization, by contrast, is the result of economic and financial cooperation.
answerFeedback.630b02b7-5f66-4dc2-8edf-910558ec85ee: Correct because globalization is the result of economic and financial cooperation. It is carried out mostly by non-state actors, such as corporations, individuals, or organizations.
answerFeedback.d00a1fcc-a17d-40bc-8b3e-b5463d309f8f: Incorrect because political cooperation and non-cooperation is one lens by which to consider geopolitical actors—primarily national or state actors. Globalization, by contrast, is the result of economic and financial cooperation.

entry.title: ITEM_20170608316
entry.itemBody: A company has announced that it is going to distribute a group of long-lived assets to its owners in a spin-off. The most appropriate way to account for the assets until the distribution occurs is to classify them as:

answerFeedback.6793a557-7ba8-47b2-9852-bab374addf55: Correct. Long-lived assets that will be disposed of other than by sale, such as in a spin-off, an exchange for other assets, or abandonment, are classified as held for use until disposal and continue to be depreciated until that time.
answerFeedback.7942b7a7-20db-45ab-8c82-0405a33937d7: Incorrect. The assets would be held for use until disposal, but would continue to be depreciated.
answerFeedback.aafc0105-78fe-48de-af56-67d429bb99d2: Incorrect. Assets to be disposed of by means other than by sale are not classified as held for sale.

choices.itemBody: A. held for sale with no depreciation taken.
B. held for use until disposal with no deprecation taken.
C. held for use until disposal with depreciation continuing to be taken.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.05-Econ-Horvath-05
entry.itemBody: Credit cycles tend to be:

answerFeedback.1b8fe5cf-a4e1-43de-a056-32d46a27a0e4: Incorrect because credit cycles tend to be longer, deeper, and sharper than business cycles.
answerFeedback.8104db96-448d-483e-a2dd-f08c289a2e74: Incorrect because credit cycles tend to be longer, deeper, and sharper than business cycles.
answerFeedback.a99b4694-13c6-4154-a15b-82203d32c9a8: Correct because credit cycles tend to be longer, deeper, and sharper than business cycles. Although the length of a business cycle varies from peak to trough, the average length of a credit cycle is mostly found to be longer than that of the business cycle.

choices.itemBody: B. of the same length as business cycles.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.09-Quant-Chua-03
entry.itemBody: The continuously compounded return:

answerFeedback.2063123f-b30f-4b78-b5dc-c5c1f8976c1f: Incorrect because the continuously compounded return from t to t + 1 is rt,t+1 = ln(St+1/St). St+1/St is always positive because both St+1 and St are positive, even if St+1 < St. The negative return is the resultant of the logarithm function and not the argument.
answerFeedback.7305a119-3f1e-402c-8feb-c1a7d23d1b94:
Incorrect because the continuously compounded return from t to t + 1 is r­t,t+1 = ln(St+1/St) = ln(1 + Rt,t+1) < Rt,t+1, i.e. the continuously compounded return is less than the holding period return, or Rt,t+1 = exp(rt,t+1) – 1 > rt,t+1, i.e. the holding period return is greater than the continuously compounded return. 
Alternatively, a simple counterexample can be calculated to disprove this, e.g. for a price increase from 100 to 110, the holding period return R = 110/100 – 1 = 0.1, and the continuously compounded return r = ln(110/100) = 0.0953 < R. Hence the statement cannot be correct.
answerFeedback.da1c5517-9d63-4140-85df-e4b5ed61efc8: Correct because the continuously compounded return to time T is the sum of the one-period continuously compounded returns.

choices.itemBody: A. is higher than the holding period return for a given time period.
B. for multiple time periods is the sum of the one-period continuously compounded returns.
C. cannot be calculated for negative holding period returns because the natural logarithm of a negative number is not a real number.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.01-CorpIssuers-Pitrakkou-04
entry.itemBody: Which of the following is an assumption in Modigliani and Miller’s capital structure framework?

answerFeedback.73730afa-2855-495b-8be4-0adb5f6f74b8: Incorrect because the assumption is that investors have homogeneous and not heterogeneous expectations about future earnings. In their theoretical framework, MM assumed that all investors have homogeneous expectations about expected future corporate earnings and the riskiness of those earnings. Their assumptions, including a world of perfect capital markets—in which there are no taxes, no transaction costs, and no bankruptcy costs, and all investors have equal ('symmetric') information.
answerFeedback.a8dd7006-31d8-437d-8b1c-d6e61d8ed8ff: Incorrect because the assumption is that investors can borrow and lend at the risk free rate. In their theoretical framework, MM assumed that all investors have homogeneous expectations about expected future corporate earnings and the riskiness of those earnings. Their assumptions, including a world of perfect capital markets—in which there are no taxes, no transaction costs, and no bankruptcy costs, and all investors have equal ('symmetric') information.
answerFeedback.d6e853d0-447a-4243-8e57-5884dd5347a7: Correct because given their assumptions, Modigliani and Miller proved that changing the capital structure does not affect firm value, in part because individual investors can create any capital structure they prefer for the company by borrowing and lending in their own accounts in addition to holding shares in the company. This 'homemade' leverage argument relies on the MM assumption that investors can lend and borrow at the risk-free rate.

choices.itemBody: A. Investors can lend and borrow at the risk free rate
B. Interest expense is deductible from income for tax purposes
C. Investors have heterogeneous expectations about future corporate earnings

entry.title: ITEM_20170531045
entry.itemBody: An expansionary fiscal policy is least likely to include an increase in:

answerFeedback.1421df20-eb6c-442c-a058-4f4d7a3bafc8: Incorrect. An expansionary fiscal policy means that government increases its purchases of goods and services and/or cuts tax rates to increase aggregate demand.
answerFeedback.5724b550-ef87-468e-b437-90d5d90df9ef: Incorrect. A rise in the budget deficit would be associated with an expansionary fiscal policy.
answerFeedback.b0b1a5a3-084a-4cea-9d9e-beb423bdea5f: Correct. An expansionary fiscal policy means that the government increases its purchases of goods and services and/or cuts tax rates to increase aggregate demand. Furthermore, an increase in the budget deficit would be associated with an expansionary fiscal policy.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.08-CorpIssuers-Simsek-02
entry.itemBody: Which of the following strategies is most common in business-to-business markets where the universe of potential customers is relatively small and easily reached?

answerFeedback.182d942e-06ca-4298-afca-da909099f1a5: Incorrect because the common channel strategy in this case is direct sales. Direct sales is a common strategy in B2B markets where the universe of potential customers is relatively small and easily reached. With an omnichannel strategy, both digital and physical channels are used to complete a sale.
answerFeedback.7f8856bc-4d69-4032-bdc4-f6f6b843a5ff: Correct because direct sales is a common strategy in B2B markets where the universe of potential customers is relatively small and easily reached.
answerFeedback.fb3d8367-19af-449f-a17a-2f8e5dc51aba: Incorrect because the common channel strategy in this case is direct sales. Direct sales is a common strategy in B2B markets where the universe of potential customers is relatively small and easily reached. The traditional channel strategy is typically reflected in the flow of finished goods (e.g., from manufacturer to wholesaler, retailer, and end customer), each with its own physical facilities and with the product sold and purchased at each stage.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-03704
entry.itemBody: All else being equal, during periods of rising prices and constant inventory quantities, a company using the weighted average cost inventory valuation method most likely reports a:

answerFeedback.1294a0c2-2746-4f8f-a2cc-83c54ae79b89: Incorrect because in an environment of rising inventory unit costs and constant or increasing inventory quantities, FIFO (in comparison with weighted average cost or LIFO) will allocate a lower amount of the total cost of goods available for sale to cost of sales on the income statement and a higher amount to ending inventory on the balance sheet. Therefore, the gross profit margin will be lower under the weighted average cost method than under FIFO.
answerFeedback.af14d910-3224-47c2-9268-8e6f2c300289: Incorrect because in an environment of rising inventory unit costs and constant or increasing inventory quantities, FIFO (in comparison with weighted average cost or LIFO) will allocate a lower amount of the total cost of goods available for sale to cost of sales on the income statement and a higher amount to ending inventory on the balance sheet. Inventory turnover ratio is Cost of Goods Sold ÷ Average inventory. Because cost of goods sold is higher and average inventory is lower under weighted average cost than under FIFO, the inventory turnover ratio will be higher under weighted average cost than FIFO.
answerFeedback.ba7b2bcb-77ff-45b0-95f5-b6a1be6b77a6: Correct because the cash conversion cycle will be shorter using weighted average cost than FIFO. Cash conversion cycle = DOH + DSO (Days of Sales Outstanding) – Number of days of payables. The number of Days of Inventory on Hand (DOH) is lower under weighted average cost than FIFO, due to the higher Inventory Turnover ratio using weighted average cost. DOH = Number of days in period ÷ Inventory turnover. Inventory turnover = COGS ÷ Average inventory. Weighted average cost will have a higher Inventory Turnover ratio than FIFO as COGS is higher and Average Inventory is lower than under FIFO.

choices.itemBody: A. higher gross profit margin than if using FIFO.
B. lower inventory turnover ratio than if using FIFO.
C. shorter cash conversion cycle than if using FIFO.

entry.title: ITEM_20170502104
entry.itemBody: A credit rating agency assesses a company’s corporate governance structure as favorable to creditor rights. The most likely impact of this assessment on the company is a(n):

answerFeedback.2dd78f0e-baa3-4386-9242-5f771c906b4d: Incorrect. Governance arrangements that help protect creditor rights can reduce a company’s cost of debt and default risk.
answerFeedback.35bb0608-db81-42ce-9818-fb07256e7aff: Correct. Governance arrangements that help protect creditor rights can reduce a company’s cost of debt and default risk.
answerFeedback.cc1f6bb9-ae43-46f1-a008-d521745fd476: Incorrect. Good corporate governance usually results in better (increased) financial performance, not decreased.

choices.itemBody: A. reduction in its cost of debt.
B. increase in its risk of default.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.09-Quant-Zhang-04
entry.itemBody: Which of the following statements about dispersion measures is most accurate?

answerFeedback.17ddeec4-d050-4ab2-a282-993c2988247c: Incorrect because the variance is measured in squared units. Standard deviation is more easily interpreted than the variance because standard deviation is expressed in the same unit of measurement as the observations.
answerFeedback.eed10cfe-3f05-4981-81c3-119cc818045b: Incorrect because a disadvantage is that the range uses only two pieces of information from the distribution. It cannot tell us how the data are distributed.
answerFeedback.f898af10-6509-4131-99f2-194c67f9d6df: Correct because, in the formula for the sample variance, the quantity n – 1 is also known as the number of degrees of freedom in estimating the population variance, where n is the number of observations in the sample.

choices.itemBody: A. The range shows how the data are distributed
B. The variance is expressed in the same unit of measurement as the observations
C. The number of degrees of freedom in estimating the population variance with the sample variance is equal to the sample size minus one

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2021.03-CorpIssuers-Sabau-13
entry.itemBody: Which of the following is most likely a drag on a company's liquidity position?

answerFeedback.0342d8e2-7637-428d-bff9-351537f7ed89: Incorrect because reduced credit lines represents a pull on liquidity. A pull on liquidity is when disbursements are paid too quickly or trade credit availability is limited, requiring companies to expend funds before they receive funds from sales that could cover the liability. Major pulls on payments include the following: Making payments early, Reduced credit limits, Limits on short-term lines of credit or Low liquidity positions.
answerFeedback.bc17a21a-da43-49c1-9c77-c76f25a3df8d: Correct because a drag on liquidity is when receipts lag, creating pressure from the decreased available funds. Major drags on receipts involve pressures from credit management and deterioration in other assets and include the following: Uncollected receivables, Obsolete inventory and tight credit.
answerFeedback.ea6bbaa8-8d89-4c9a-a381-84c2673525c2: Incorrect because reduced credit lines represents a pull on liquidity. A pull on liquidity is when disbursements are paid too quickly or trade credit availability is limited, requiring companies to expend funds before they receive funds from sales that could cover the liability. Major pulls on payments include the following: Making payments early, Reduced credit limits, Limits on short-term lines of credit or Low liquidity positions.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020A-FRA-Lin-24
entry.itemBody:
An analyst gathers the following information (in € thousands) about a machine:

Carrying amount prior to impairment 50
Present value of expected future cash flows 46
Fair value 48
Costs to sell 3

Impairment loss (in € thousands) is:

answerFeedback.a29b169b-3a2f-4314-a714-f99dc52dbb74: Incorrect because it omits the costs to sell in the calculation of the recoverable amount. Accordingly, Impairment loss = Carrying amount – Max[Fair value, Present value of expected future cash flows] = 50 – Max[48, 46] = 50 – 48 = 2.
answerFeedback.df09da01-f7b4-4104-b0b6-d2da97f7433b: Correct because under IAS 36, an impairment loss is measured as the excess of carrying amount over the recoverable amount of the asset. The recoverable amount of an asset is defined as the higher of its fair value less costs to sell and its value in use. Value in use is based on the present value of expected future cash flows. Accordingly, Impairment loss = Carry amount – Max[(Fair value – Costs to sell), Present value of expected future cash flows] = 50 – Max[(48 – 3), 46] = 50 – 46 = 4.
answerFeedback.e85d2d41-1b4b-414f-9c3a-65d8a30d7ec1: Incorrect because it calculates the recoverable amount as the lower (instead of higher) of the asset's fair value less costs to sell and its value in use. Accordingly, Impairment loss = Carrying amount – Min[(Fair value – Costs to sell), Present value of expected future cash flows] = 50 – Min[(48 – 3), 46] = 50 – 45 = 5.

entry.title: ITEM_2019B FRA 11PWN
entry.itemBody:
An analyst gathers the following information (in £ millions) about a company:

Total assets 600
Total liabilities 120
Total equity 480
Total debt 60

Based only on this information, the financial leverage ratio is:

answerFeedback.5d6fac8f-58f1-4257-8e88-994c39f28cfa: Incorrect because it calculates the Total debt ratio (not financial leverage ratio), which is Total debt / Total assets; or = 60 / 600 = 0.10.
answerFeedback.ab3ab991-0b60-47e1-94e2-2be973f2e874: Incorrect because it incorrectly calculates financial leverage ratio as Total liabilities / Total equity = 120 / 480 = 0.25.
answerFeedback.da7bc909-f0ca-4124-9246-41fc9aec5959: Correct because financial leverage ratio = Total assets / Total equity. Accordingly, Financial leverage = 600 / 480 = 1.25.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2023.06-CorpIssuers-Trent-23
entry.itemBody: When estimating a target capital structure, the equity weight associated with a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.6 is closest to:

answerFeedback.03c7faa1-24ad-4889-9749-f5254d36c3b6: Incorrect because this number (incorrectly) assumes that a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.6 corresponds to 60% debt.
answerFeedback.4534b21d-017c-42a0-812d-96b1404612d6: Incorrect because this number represents the debt weight, not equity weight. A simple way of transforming a debt-to-equity ratio (D/E) into a weight— that is, D/(D + E)—is to divide D/E by 1 + D/E. In this case the debt weight is 0.6/1.6 = 37.5%
answerFeedback.9a5c1932-1ddc-4a05-921f-f705e7b4a579: Correct because a simple way of transforming a debt-to-equity ratio (D/E) into a weight that is, D/(D + E)is to divide D/E by 1 + D/E. In this case, Debt weight = 0.6/1.6 = 37.5%. If the weight of debt is 37.5%, the weight of equity will be (1-37.5%) = 62.5%.
